entry.title: Get Ready for SAP TechEd with Data and Analytics Learning Opportunities
entry.content:
SAP TechEd is right around the corner- the perfect time to strengthen your data and analytics skills. Explore learning paths designed to help you connect, model, and analyze data with confidence, and discover how to transform insight into real business impact. Build your expertise through self-paced learning journeys, instructor-led trainings, interactive value journeys, demos, and basic trials. 

üéì Certification benefits: 

  • All SAP TechEd and SAP TechEd on Tour participants receive a 25% discount on SAP Certification, with two exam attempts. 
  •  If you‚Äôre attending in person in Berlin, Bangalore, or Louisville, you can take a free certification exam on site 

Get a head start on your SAP TechEd journey with the latest learning and certification resources.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: DA262-Enabling clean core development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code
entry.content:
A couple of words about me:

My name is Shraddha Shetty and I‚Äôm a Product Manager on the SAP HANA Product Management team, with a focus on Developer Experience. I began my journey at SAP in 2021 as a Developer and later transitioned into Product Management.

Join My Session!
DA262 | Enabling Clean Core Development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code
üóìÔ∏è Wednesday, Nov 5 | 3:30 PM ‚Äì 5:30 PM CET

What you will learn about:

Join our hands-on workshop DA262 | Enabling Clean Core Development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code to explore how side-by-side extensions can help you innovate without compromising your clean core.

In this hands-on session, you‚Äôll explore how SAP HANA Cloud, the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), and SAP Build Code work together to simplify and accelerate development. Through guided exercises, participants will learn to create full-stack applications, integrate business services, and extend SAP solutions with agility and intelligence. You‚Äôll also get hands-on experience exploring HANA Cloud features such as adding native artifacts, and accessing data lake files to build smarter, data-driven applications.

By the end of the workshop, you‚Äôll gain practical insights and skills to confidently build scalable, cloud-ready applications while maintaining a clean and extensible core. Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to enhance your developer experience and unlock the full potential of SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code.

Co-speakers:

  • Thomas Hammer  ‚Äì Lead Product Manager, SAP HANA Cloud, SAP SE

  • Christoph Morgen ‚Äì Senior Product Manager, SAP HANA Cloud AI, SAP SE

  • Roman Belosludtsev ‚Äì Product Manager, SAP HANA Cloud, SAP SE

Other related sessions I recommend:

DA261 | Unlocking AI-Driven Insights from Your Business Data in SAP HANA Cloud
Hands-on Workshop
When: Tue, Nov 4 | 12:30 PM ‚Äì 2:30 PM CET

DA200 | Help Future-Proof Your Database Landscape with SAP HANA Cloud
Deep Dive
When: Wed, Nov 5 | 10:15 AM ‚Äì 11:00 AM CET

DA202 | Extensibility at Scale: Build Intelligent Applications with SAP HANA Cloud
Deep Dive
When: Wed, Nov 5 | 1:15 PM ‚Äì 2:00 PM CET

ST115 | SAP HANA Cloud: The Database for Business AI
Strategy Talk
When: Wed, Nov 5 | 2:15 PM ‚Äì 2:40 PM CET

DA201 | Accelerating Your AI Strategy with SAP HANA Cloud
Deep Dive
When: Thu, Nov 6 | 9:00 AM ‚Äì 9:45 AM CET

DA263 | SAP HANA Cloud: Advisors and Automation
Hands-on Workshop
When: Thu, Nov 6 | 9:00 AM ‚Äì 11:00 AM CET

DA817 | What's Next for SAP HANA Cloud: Road Map and Innovation Highlights
Road Map
When: Thu, Nov 6 | 1:30 PM ‚Äì 1:55 PM CET

DA904 | SAP HANA Cloud: A Database for SAP Business AI
Demo Station

Related community topic pages:

Best Practice collection working with Business Application Studio(BAS) and HANA Deployment Infrastructure(HDI)

Looking forward to seeing you! üëã‚ú®üöÄ

Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to get hands-on with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code, and learn how to extend your SAP landscape while keeping your core clean. Join us to gain practical skills, connect with experts, and see firsthand how to accelerate innovation in your applications. Register and be part of this interactive workshop.

üí¨Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

As you gear up for SAP TechEd 2025, we‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts and experiences with SAP HANA Cloud and clean core development. Share your insights, ideas, and challenges with us:

  • When building full-stack applications, do you prefer CAP services or other development approaches? Why?

  • How do you currently manage data modeling and business logic in your SAP HANA Cloud applications

  • What are your expectations for SAP TechEd 2025, and which hands-on topics excite you the most?

Drop your thoughts in the comments below

entry.title: 9 Things You Need to Know About SAP Community at SAP TechEd in Berlin
entry.content:
9 Things You Need to Know About SAP Community at SAP TechEd in Berlin 

SAP TechEd in Berlin is just around the corner and it‚Äôs not your typical tech conference: it‚Äôs where SAP Community comes home. To help you make the most of your time on-site, here are 9 must-know ways to experience the community in action. 

1. Connect at the Community Clubhouse 

Think of this as your community hub. It‚Äôs the place to meet other members alongside the SAP Community team, swap ideas, share experiences, and just hang out with people who are as passionate about SAP as you are.  Come join your community in Hall 1.2  

2. Dive into the Developer Garage 

The Developer Garage is a hands-on playground where you can work alongside Developer Advocates on real projects. With 7 tracks and 32 tutorials, it‚Äôs the perfect space to get practical experience and try out the latest SAP technologies. 

3. Learn from the Experts 

From product owners in AI, ABAP, and CAP to SAP Champions and Mentors, the ‚ÄúMeet the Experts‚Äù tables are where you can ask questions, get insights, and gain practical tips straight from the people building SAP solutions. 

4. Explore the Community Theatre 

Catch 33 community talks, participate in trivia competitions, and check out the DemoJam at the end of Day 1 (15:00‚Äì16:15 Berlin time, session DJ1295), hosted by Mr. Bluebeard himself. Teams will have 6 minutes to tackle a real business challenge using SAP BTP, showcasing innovation, creativity, and fun. Stop by the Community Clubhouse to see who takes home the DemoJam trophy.  

5. Explore Learning and Certification Opportunities 

SAP TechEd in Berlin offers a dedicated space for certifications. Learn what certifications are available, understand their value, and even take free onsite certification exams for SAP Generative AI Developer and SAP Build Developer in Berlin, Bangalore, or Louisville. Find more details and register for the exam. 

6. Step into the SAP TechEd Experience Center 

Discover the future of enterprise technology, from Business AI to live robotic demos. Experience gamified learning, explore customer use cases, and take home a smart tag and learning badge to continue your journey long after the event.  Make your way to Hall 3.2 for all the experience center has to offer. 

7. Get to Know the SAP Community Platform 

Whether you‚Äôre new or seasoned, the SAP Community info space will help you navigate the platform, find groups, and even learn how to become an event organizer or start a local location group. 

8. Connect with Mentors and Champions 

Curious about the SAP Mentors or SAP Champions programs? Stop by booth 103 in the Clubhouse, learn about the programs, and discover how you can become more involved in the community. 

9. Don‚Äôt Miss the Developer Keynote 

The developer keynote is a highlight for anyone interested in the latest innovations and the roadmap of SAP technologies. 

SAP TechEd in Berlin isn‚Äôt just about sessions and workshops, it‚Äôs about being part of the SAP Community in real life. Whether you‚Äôre rolling up your sleeves in a hands-on tutorial, swapping stories at a casual meetup, or catching insights from an expert talk, every corner of the event is designed to help you connect, share, and grow alongside fellow community members. 

We can‚Äôt wait to see you there! Come ready to learn, share, and be part of the SAP Community energy ü§ù

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Where‚Äôs Waldo ‚Ä¶ ah ‚Ä¶ Terraform?
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Christian Lechner and I‚Äôm Product Manager for the BTP CLI as well as for the Terraform activities around SAP BTP.

I love developer experience and want to make their life as well as the life of SAP BTP administrators easier so that they can focus on what really matters when developing business applications and extension.

My Sessions:   

The title of this post already gives a hint. There is no standalone session that deals with Terraform. No need to be sad though, we managed to bring some Terraform magic into the following sessions showcasing that Terraform can help you at various scenarios that might not be obvious at a first glance:

  • XP202 | How to efficiently operate your applications on SAP BTP, Wednesday, Nov 511:15 AM - 12:00 PM CET (deep dive)
  • XP263 | Advanced tools for administrators in SAP BTP, Tuesday, Nov 4, 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET (hands-on workshop)
What you will learn about: 

Let‚Äôs start with the deep-dive ‚ÄúXP202 | How to efficiently operate your applications on SAP BTP‚Äù: this session gives more background information on the day 2 tasks when operating cloud native apps.
In this session you will get some insights on what to consider around Terraform focusing on the challenges after you have successfully deployed the infrastructure for your app. Of course, we will also discuss topics like observability and alike as central parts of day 2 operations.
While the session complements the hands-on workshop ‚ÄúXP265 | Master managing cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime‚Äù, the hands-on session is no prerequiste for the deep dive.

The second chance to learn about Terraform is the hands-on workshop ‚ÄúXP263 | Advanced tools for administrators in SAP BTP‚Äù. This hands-on workshop puts the spotlight on the FinOps part of SAP BTP and the increasing options SAP BTP offers to deal with this important topic.
A perfect fit for Terraform, right ü§î? Not at a first glance. But here‚Äôs the point: provisioning and managing your account structure with Terraform can make your life much easier when it comes to FinOps as you will ensure a consistent account structure including features like labels that support you in mastering the FinOps challenges. That‚Äôs why you will learn how to set up your accounts via Terraform and how to enhance the account structure in a consistent way keeping you on the light side of the (FinOps) force.

Co-speakers: 

 I have the honor to share the stage with:

  • Keren Rotenberg (@keren_rotenberg) 
  • Michal Keidar (@michal_keidar) 
  • Stephan Klevenz (@sklevenz) 
  • Yaron Livneh (@Yaron-Livneh) 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

As mentioned before the following hands-on workshops might be of interest when working with cloud-native apps in the Cloud Floundry or Kyma runtime:

  • XP264 | Explore how to run cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Kyma runtime
  • XP265 | Master-managing cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime
Related community managed tags you should subscribe to remain informed about this topic: 

DevOps 

Related community topic pages:   

DevOps 

Looking forward to seeing you: 

No matter if you want to start with Terraform or want to get some deeper insights on what‚Äôs up after provisioning your resources with Terraform we got you covered.

Besides the pure learning aspect keep in mind: TechEd was never about learning only but connecting and discussing with peers, so take the chance to learn with and from others on their journey with SAP BTP operations.

Now let‚Äôs hear from you: 

What are your experiences with operational tasks on SAP BTP using Terraform or the BTP CLI? Stumbled across some rough edges that you would like to discuss. Ideas how to improve the experience with Terraform or the BTP CLI?

I‚Äôd love to hear and learn from you ‚Äì let‚Äôs meet at SAP TechEd 2025 and improve the SAP BTP experience together!

entry.title: TechEd 2025 Berlin: Production Readiness Isn't Optional: A Practical Look at XP265
entry.content:
We all know the drill. Your app works in development, passes testing, and sits deployed on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry. Then comes the inevitable question from management: "Is this actually ready for production traffic?"

If you've ever felt uncertain answering that question, XP265 - Mastering Cloud-Native Applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime at SAP TechEd Berlin addresses exactly this gap.

The Reality Check You Need

The session puts you in a realistic scenario: 48 hours before go-live with a NodeJS incident management application built on SAP CAP. It's integrated with S/4HANA, follows 12-factor patterns, and looks production-ready. But looking ready and being ready are different things.

You'll work through the actual operational challenges that determine whether your system survives contact with real users or becomes tomorrow's outage post-mortem.

What You'll Cover

Production Readiness Assessment: The sizing validation, derlivery and observability setup that should happen before any production deployment. Not the fun stuff, but the necessary stuff.

Operational Monitoring: How to use SAP Cloud ALM and Cloud Logging to understand what's actually happening in your system. Because guessing isn't a monitoring strategy.

Scaling Under Load: Testing whether your auto-scaling configuration works when traffic spikes hit. Better to find out in a controlled environment than during peak business hours.

Why It Matters

The techniques come from how SAP's own teams handle production operations - the monitoring approaches that catch issues early, the scaling patterns that actually work, and the troubleshooting methods for when things inevitably go wrong.

You'll learn to work with SAP Cloud ALM for centralized observability, use Cloud Logging with OpenTelemetry for distributed system insights, and implement scaling strategies with the SAP Autoscaler that respond appropriately to load changes.

The Details

November 05, 2025 | 1:00 PM CET
SAP TechEd Berlin
Hands-on session with live SAP BTP environments

This isn't a demo - you'll work with actual BTP environments and real operational scenarios. Scenario will be only available on-site during the Hands-On

Gest your spot today & register for XP265

If you're responsible for production deployments or operational support, this session covers the practical skills that make the difference between confident deployments and stressful launches.

This session is part of the TechEd 2025 / Berlin on-site track "Managing your enterprise applications on multi-cloud foundation for SAP BTP - find all other exciting sessions directly in the session catalogue.

entry.title: Vladimirs Semikins (SAP Champion) Expert Playlist for SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin
entry.content:
It's been a while since my last in-person SAP TechEd, it was back in year 2018 in Barcelona. And, I'm really excited as I'm going to attend SAP TechEd Berlin this year. As there is a ton of different and interesting sessions, I wanted to share ‚Äúmy playlist‚Äù or sessions I'm planning to attend.
 
Ok, here we go - besides Keynote, DemoJam, meeting SAP Community folks, (ex-)colleagues and friends - this is my list
  • ST103 | Accelerating the cloud transition with a guided transition methodology
  • XP200 | Fortifying SAP BTP: Best practices for more-secure software development
  • DA160 | SAP Business Data Cloud from set up to streamline: A practical walk-through
  • AD161 | Integration of SAP Business Data Cloud with CAP and SAP Build
  • CT1257 | SAP Process Orchestration migration: Using AI tools for maximum gains
  • ST118 | The future of enterprise automation: Workflows, Joule skills, and AI agents
  • CT1262 | Extending the Smart Way: Hybrid Architecture with SAP BTP, Joule and AI
  • DT103 | Guidance to ease your transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private
Also, I will try to get SAP Certification ‚ÄúAI Developer‚Äù - JFYI as a SAP TechEd Berlin registrant, you are eligible to try yourself in getting one SAP Certification, more info you can find here - https://learning.sap.com/teched/certifications
 
See you all there!

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, governance
entry.content:
Dear Data-Enthusiasts!

Are you still unsure how your data management approach can benefit of SAP Business Data Cloud, what data products are, and which advantages SAP-managed data products bring?

Then you might want to attend our session SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, and governance (DA100) at SAP TechEd in Berlin on Tuesday, Nov 4 at 9:30 AM.

Besides the questions above, we will also discuss the role of SAP Master Data Governance and how to use it for improved data quality, analytics, and AI.

We are Florian Neukirch @FlorianN and Andreas Seifried @AndreasSeifried, looking forward meeting you during and after our lecture!

Florian is a Senior Product Management Specialist for SAP BDC&I. His focus is on Data Products, Catalog, Marketplace and Data Product Governance. Florian started his career at SAP in Solution Management and has taken over several roles in the SAP BDC&I organization since then.

Andreas is a product manager for SAP Master Data Governance and is engaged in shaping SAP‚Äôs portfolio for data management since he joined the development organization in 2004. Andreas started at SAP as a technology consultant in 2001, when he helped organizations all over the world to solve their data and process integration challenges.

We will introduce you to the concept of data products and explore how SAP-managed data products can enhance your data architecture. We'll delve into the significance of master data for analytics, processes, and AI, and discuss upcoming features like the data product studio.

Other related sessions that we recommend:

  • DA203 | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse by @kpsauer and @kurzdo93 
  • DA266 | Operationalizing AI with SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud by @san_tran 

Related community topic pages:

SAP Master Data Governance | SAP Community

SAP Business Data Cloud | SAP Community

SAP Datasphere | SAP Community

Looking forward to seeing you in Berlin!

Florian and Andreas

 

Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

  • What are your experiences with SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Master Data Governance?
  • Is it valid to have distinct views on (generic) data management and master data management? What are the reasons?

Please add your thoughts as comments to this blog. Thanks!

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Analyze and optimize front-end application performance
entry.content:

entry.title: S/4HANA Cloud Public Security now integrates with leading SIEM solutions
entry.content:
Cloud Security Just Got Easier: S/4HANA Cloud Public Security now integrates with leading SIEM solutions

Introduction

We have some exciting news to share, which emphasizes the strategic importance of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and delivers upon our promise to strengthen cloud security: our security relevant APIs are now integrated with three major SIEM platforms ‚Äì Microsoft Sentinel, Splunk, and Security Bridge.

This integration opens up new possibilities for customers to connect their SAP Cloud environments with their existing security operations, enabling faster threat detection, streamlined compliance, and better visibility across hybrid landscapes.

Three Use Cases, One API Strategy

The security APIs in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition are designed to support three major use cases:

  • SIEM (Security Information and Event Management): For real-time event monitoring and threat detection.
  • SSPM (SaaS Security Posture Management): To assess and maintain your system‚Äôs security configuration.
  • CASB (Cloud Access Security Broker): For monitoring user behavior and enforcing security policies.

Even within the shared responsibility model for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, these use cases will give you valuable insight into your security posture, enable a comprehensive security monitoring and will help you to enforce your security policies across your entire system landscape, including your cloud applications.

The Corner Stone: Security Audit Log (SAL) API

As mentioned, security in the cloud is a shared effort. SAP, as the cloud provider, handles infrastructure-level protection ‚Äì think database security, OS patching, and physical data center controls. But what happens inside the application ‚Äì user access, configuration, and monitoring ‚Äì is the customer‚Äôs responsibility.

That‚Äôs where the SAL API comes in. It provides direct access to the Security Audit Log, capturing key events like successful and failed logins, transaction starts, or authorization checks. These logs are essential for understanding what‚Äôs happening in customers applications and to identify potential threats as soon as they occur.

Traditionally, SIEM tools have focused on infrastructure logs. Without application-level visibility, you‚Äôre missing half the picture. The SAL API bridges that gap. It‚Äôs a RESTful API delivering data in JSON format, ready for integration with modern security platforms. You can filter by event type, time range, and more ‚Äì making it suitable for real-time monitoring, forensic analysis, and audit reporting.

The SAL API is your window into the application layer ‚Äì and a key enabler for fulfilling your responsibilities under the shared security model.

More Than Just SAL: Event-Based vs. Configuration APIs

But there is more for a comprehensive picture of your security posture than just capturing SAL events. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition offers a rich set of additional security-relevant APIs, and it‚Äôs important to understand how they map to the different use cases.

Event-Based APIs (for SIEM and CASB)

These APIs deliver real-time or historical event data and are ideal for SIEM systems that correlate and analyze logs for threat detection and incident response:

  • Security Audit Log API: Captures system-level events like logins, transaction starts, and authorization checks.
  • Read Access Log API: Records user access to sensitive data objects, helping detect unauthorized access.
  • Business User Change API: Tracks changes to user master data, such as name updates or role assignments.
  • Business Role Change API: Logs modifications to business roles, including who made the change and when.

These APIs are essential for building audit trails, supporting forensic investigations, and maintaining compliance.

Configuration & Static APIs (for SSPM)

SSPM tools focus on the current security posture of your system ‚Äì how it‚Äôs configured and whether it aligns with best practices. These APIs provide read access to configuration data and help detect misconfigurations or unused entities:

  • Business User & Role Read APIs: Provides current state information about users and roles in the system.
  • Communication User, System & Arrangement APIs: Offers insights into how external systems and users are connected and authenticated.
  • HTTP Protection Configuration APIs: Helps monitoring and validating content security policies and allowlist configurations.
  • Trusted Certificates API: Lists certificates used for secure communication, helping ensure encryption and trust relationships are properly maintained.

Together, these APIs will provide you with all the information you need in order to support the three use cases mentioned above. But how do these APIs fit into a more general security strategy, beyond your business applications. That‚Äôs where our partners come in.

Partner Integrations: It‚Äôs Happening

We‚Äôre super excited that our partners have reacted quickly on the recently published APIs and have already integrated SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition into their security solutions.  Microsoft Sentinel, Splunk, and Security Bridge have built integrations, starting with the SAL API, so customers can get started quickly ‚Äì no custom development required.

If you‚Äôre heading to SAP TechEd, you‚Äôll hear more about these integrations and how they fit into SAP‚Äôs broader security strategy. It‚Äôs not just a feature drop ‚Äì it‚Äôs part of a bigger story about making cloud security smarter and more connected.

Final Thoughts

The SAL API and its companion interfaces mark a turning point in how customers can manage security in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. With native SIEM integrations, a clear shared responsibility model, and growing partner support, it‚Äôs never been easier to take control of your cloud security.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Guidance to Ease Your Transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Matthias Stegmueller and I‚Äôm driving the product development for SAP‚Äôs Business Data Transformation Center as Lead Product Owner. My focus is to accelerate cloud transitions through SAP‚Äôs Transformation Portfolio, enabling business transformation via a unified methodology.

My Session: DT103 ‚Äì Guidance to Ease Your Transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private

 üìÖ Wednesday, Nov 5    ‚è≤ 4:15 PM - 5:00 PM CET

 

What you will learn about: 

Transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private can be complex‚Äîbut it doesn‚Äôt have to be. In this session, J√∂rg and me will guide you through the available transition paths, including New Implementation, System Conversion, and Selective Data Transition. You‚Äôll explore how SAP‚Äôs Business Transformation Center and integrated toolchain support a smooth, data-driven journey with minimal disruption. Learn how to leverage tools like the Digital Blueprint, System Transition Workbench, and Data Transition Validation to accelerate your move while reducing risk and cost. Whether you're a customer or a partner, this session offers practical insights, demos, and best practices to help you confidently navigate your cloud ERP transformation.

 Co-speakers: 

 @joerg_marenk 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

DT264 | How to start transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private
ST103 | Accelerating the cloud transition with a guided transition methodology
CS102 | Speed up your cloud transition: Maximize efficiency and minimize costs
CS162 | Data-driven transition guidance toward the cloud
CS803 | A journey through next-generation transformation tools

Related community topic pages: 

 SAP Business Transformation Center

 Looking forward to seeing you: 

 Don't miss the chance to learn how to secure your organization online services as well as your online customers accounts from malicious actors.  Register now and be part of these sessions

 Now let‚Äôs hear from you: 

  • Did you start your journey to SAP Cloud ERP Private already? What are your current observations and challenges and expectation towards SAP to accelerate it? 
  • Which transition path did you choose (if already) and why?

Feel free to answer these questions by adding a comment in the comments section. Looking forward to hearing from you!

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: AI agent hub: how to discover and control all your AI agents
entry.content:
A couple of words about me:

My name is Michelle and I am a senior product manager at SAP LeanIX with 5+ years expertise in ideating, positioning and driving enterprise SaaS adoption across the entire product lifecycle. I know firsthand how to distinguish between what customers want and truly need, both from my background in product and product marketing ‚Äìand as a mother of a toddler.

My session:

BTM100 | AI agent hub: How to discover and control all your AI agents

Nov 5 (Wednesday) 3:15 PM - 4:00 PM CET
 
What you will learn about:

AI agents are multiplying fast ‚Äî forecasts point to billions within a few years ‚Äî and enterprises already face shadow agents, duplication, unclear ownership, and projects that never deliver business value. For developers, consultants, and enterprise architects, the technical challenge is less about models and more about discovery, governance, and measurable outcomes.

What we‚Äôll cover:

  • Why ‚Äúdiscover and control‚Äù is now a first-class enterprise concern
  • How the agent hub gives visibility across platforms and providers without vendor lock-in
  • Practical patterns: agent registries, approved-agent portals, adoption radars, and executive dashboards that help you track the adoption progress of agentic AI

Co-speakers:

@DominikRose, SVP Product SAP LeanIX

Looking forward to seeing you:

Sign up and get ready to rethink how your org discovers and controls agents before the ‚Äúshadow crowd‚Äù becomes unmanageable.

Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

Where do you build agents, and how will you govern them?

12:00 PM - 12:25 PM CET

entry.title: Shaping the Future of SAP Cloud ALM: Join My Sessions at SAP TechEd in Berlin
entry.content:
At SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin, I‚Äôm excited to lead two sessions that dive deep into how SAP Cloud ALM is evolving into an intelligent, autonomous platform that redefines how organizations manage their SAP landscapes. 

If you‚Äôre guiding your company‚Äôs cloud transformation or planning your move from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM, these sessions are for you. 

Before I share what I'm going to present about in SAP TechEd Berlin, I would like to share with you some background information. 

 

SAP‚Äôs ALM strategy and vision 

Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) is the backbone of enterprise IT, orchestrating the full lifecycle of applications - from design and build, through migration and service delivery, to ongoing operations. 

SAP‚Äôs vision is to evolve SAP Cloud ALM into a transformation execution platform, supporting the full lifecycle: Scope, Build, Migrate, and Run.  

With the new ‚ÄúScope‚Äù pillar, SAP Cloud ALM will become the central scoping hub by integrating results from the Digital Discovery Assessment (to speed up projects by re-using assessment data), the SAP Readiness Check (to include simplification items), Best Practice Guidance coming from SAP Signavio and information from the Landscape Discovery. 

In ‚ÄúBuild‚Äù, we plan to strengthen the integration between SAP Signavio and SAP Cloud ALM, and further enrich the existing capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM for process and project management, testing, and deployment management. 

With the also new ‚ÄúMigrate‚Äù pillar, we combine and enhance offerings to support customers with data migration for their cloud transformation projects, as well as integrating Custom Code Management capabilities and adding rollout and template management to support large-scale enterprise transformations. 

For the ‚ÄúRun‚Äù pillar, SAP plans to move towards autonomous ALM in three steps - from leveraging AI in Integration Monitoring, Health Monitoring, and Business Process Monitoring, through agentic AI use cases to fully autonomous ALM for implementation, powered by embedded AI and Joule agents. 

 

What will I cover at SAP TechEd 2025? 

At SAP TechEd, I am going to cover two different aspects of our ALM strategy: First, I will dive into our plans on leveraging AI in SAP Cloud ALM, and second I will lay out the roadmap of SAP Cloud ALM from an innovation persopective. 

 

Session 1: Strategy for SAP Cloud ALM with Autonomous ALM and Joule 

Session ID: ST106 
When: Tuesday, Nov. 4, 10:15am 

How can artificial intelligence revolutionize the way we manage SAP landscapes? In this strategy session, we‚Äôll explore SAP‚Äôs vision for autonomous ALM using SAP Cloud ALM ‚Äî powered by Joule, SAP‚Äôs generative AI copilot. 

You‚Äôll learn how AI agents can proactively identify and resolve operational issues, reducing manual intervention and ensuring continuous, automated system reliability. We‚Äôll also discuss SAP‚Äôs roadmap toward a fully autonomous ALM future ‚Äî where human oversight shifts from problem-solving to strategic innovation. 

 

 

Session 2: Road Map for SAP Cloud ALM 

Session ID: CS805 
When: Tuesday, Nov. 4, 11:45am 

In this deep-dive session, we‚Äôll walk through the latest innovations and upcoming features of SAP Cloud ALM. Expect insights on autonomous capabilities, integrated tool chains, and the role of the Joule copilot in simplifying daily operations. 

We‚Äôll also discuss the SAP Readiness Check for SAP Cloud ALM, designed to help customers plan and execute their transition from SAP Solution Manager with confidence. Whether you‚Äôre just getting started with Cloud ALM or looking to optimize existing operations, this session will provide practical guidance for your next steps. 

 

 

Why You Should Attend 

Both sessions are designed to help you understand what‚Äôs next for SAP Cloud ALM, but how you can get there. Join me in Berlin to explore how SAP Cloud ALM is evolving into a transformation execution platform powered by broad integrations and meaningful AI - and how your organization can benefit from it today. 

 

Now let‚Äôs hear from you: 

What are your most favorite features in SAP Cloud ALM? Let me know in the comments! 

 

#SAP #ALM #CloudALM #Strategy #Roadmap #AI #AutonomousAI

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Discover SAP Cloud ALM for operations in action
entry.content:
A couple of words about me

My name is Stephanie Jerch, and I‚Äôm a Product Manager at SAP. 

As a Solution Expert in Product Management for SAP Cloud ALM for Operations, I empower customers to benefit from its use. Before joining SAP in 2015, I previously worked for SAP Partners in consulting roles focused on Application Lifecycle Management.  

My Session(s): 

CS101 | Discover SAP Cloud ALM for operations in action

üóìÔ∏è Wednesday, Nov 5 ‚åöÔ∏è 11:15 AM - 12:00 PM CET üëâDeep Dive

What you will learn about: 

This session delves into the capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM for operations, providing a comprehensive overview of its landscape monitoring features. Participants will learn how to effectively monitor their SAP BTP environments through through the glasses of a customer. The session will highlight the latest features and functionalities. Additionally, attendees will gain an outlook on upcoming developments and works in progress, staying informed about the future direction of SAP Cloud ALM.

Co-speakers: 

Christian Niedermayer
Cross Architect, SAP SE		 Mirko Feisel
Lead BTP Plattform Engineer, Henkel AG & Co.KGaA

 

CS261 | Monitoring a custom SAP BTP application with SAP Cloud ALM for operations

üóìÔ∏è Wednesday, Nov 5. ‚åöÔ∏è 3:30 PM - 5:30 PM CET üëâHands-on Workshop

 What you will learn about: 

In this session, you will learn how to monitor a custom application on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP), including instrumenting the services, configuring SAP Build Work Zone, embedding the SAP Cloud Logging service, and activating data collection in the SAP Cloud ALM tool. Monitor clicks with SAP Cloud ALM and SAP Cloud Logging and explore the latest features.

Christian Niedermayer
Cross Architect, SAP SE		Markus Bechler
Product Manager, SAP SE 		Stefan Lahr
Product Manager, SAP SE

Other related sessions I recommend:

Related community managed tags you should subscribe to remain informed about this topic: 

 SAP Cloud ALM SAP Business Technology Platform 

 Looking forward to seeing you: 

We're excited to have you join us as we explore the powerful capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM for operations. Let's dive in and discover how to optimize your landscape monitoring with live demos and insights into the latest features and AI innovations. Looking forward to an engaging and informative time together!

Turn the tides from reactive to proactive monitoring? What are your plans?

entry.title: Learn, Transform, and Get Certified at SAP TechEd
entry.content:
SAP TechEd is almost here! Explore learning and certification opportunities designed to help you prepare for the event. Build the skills to connect strategy, processes, and people, and discover new ways to create business value through digital transformation. Visit the SAP TechEd learning zone to start preparing and make the most of your SAP TechEd experience.

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About SAP Discovery Center Before TechEd
entry.content:
SAP TechEd 2025 is approaching‚Äîthe premier annual event for SAP developers, solution architects, and IT professionals worldwide. With thousands of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities waiting for you, success at TechEd depends on how well-prepared you arrive. That's where the SAP Discovery Center's latest updates come in. 

From a comprehensive SAP AI Return-On-Investment (ROI) calculator that provides real-time financial justification for AI packages to an enhanced SAP BTP Guidance Framework that serves as your star map to best practices, these updates, these updates directly address the challenges you face every day: proving value, reducing implementation risk, and accelerating digital transformation timelines.

Whether you're a solution architect planning your next SAP Business Technology Platform implementation, a developer exploring AI possibilities, or an IT leader who needs to justify technology investments with hard numbers, the new SAP Discovery Center features will become your most valuable pre-TechEd preparation. Let's dive into what's new, why it matters, and how you can leverage these tools to maximize your TechEd experience and drive immediate value back to your organization.

AI on SAP Discovery Center

1. Enhanced AI Catalogue: Your Complete AI Solution Navigator

The SAP Business AI Catalogue has received a major upgrade that transforms how you explore and evaluate AI solutions. The catalogue now features dedicated categories for "Joule" and "AI Agent", making it easier than ever to find the specific AI capabilities you need for your organization.

Major Enhancements:

  • The catalogue now reflects SAP's new per-user-per-month commercial model, providing transparent pricing visibility
  • AI packages that bundle AI agents and features alongside consumption-based AI agents and features for flexible implementation options
  • Comma-separated value (CSV) export functionality allows you to download the entire AI catalogue for offline analysis, team sharing, and integration with your procurement processes

üîóExplore the enhanced AI Catalogue: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-catalog/

 

2. Streamlined Discovery with Intelligent Filtering

The completely redesigned filters improve the experience of searching through SAP Discovery Center‚Äôs AI offerings. The updated interface and enhanced look-and-feel make finding relevant offerings faster and more efficient.

Key Improvements:

  • Smart filters help you pinpoint AI offerings that match your specific use cases, industry, and technical requirements
  • At-a-glance information on catalogue cards provides essential details without requiring deep navigation
  • Improved user experience that reduces time-to-insight and accelerates your AI exploration journey

 

3. ROI-Driven Decision Making with the AI Estimator

The new Return-on-Investment (ROI) calculation feature added to the AI Estimator transforms how organizations evaluate and justify AI investments. With the ROI estimation, users can make more informed decisions on AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings.

Game-Changing Capabilities:

  • Real-time ROI calculations for both AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings
  • Transparent methodology that explains how ROI estimates are calculated, building confidence in your investment decisions
  • Business case support that provides the financial justification needed for executive approval and budget allocation

üîóCalculate your AI ROI: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-estimator-v1

 

4. Integrated AI and SAP BTP Service Connections

The enhanced SAP BTP Service Catalogue with clear linkage between AI offerings and SAP BTP services now shows exactly which AI offerings relate to specific services, providing comprehensive visibility into how AI capabilities can amplify your existing SAP BTP investments.

Revolutionary Features:

  • Direct AI offering visibility within SAP BTP service detail pages eliminates the guesswork in finding relevant AI capabilities
  • Improved use case planning and implementation by understanding how AI can enhance your existing SAP BTP services, and with clear connections between the AI foundation and AI capabilities

üîóExplore integrated AI offerings: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/serviceCatalog/sap-build-process-automation?region=all&tab=relatedaiofferings

Other Updates on SAP Discovery Center

1. SAP BTP Guidance Framework: Your Star Map for Guidance Assets

The new SAP BTP Guidance Framework is a resource that extends the scope for architects by providing comprehensive methodologies and guidance. This framework serves as your guide toward architecting, developing, and deploying enterprise-grade solutions on SAP BTP.

What Makes This Framework Essential:

  • Structured adoption phases provide clear direction and a proven approach for adopting SAP BTP according to industry best practices
  • Tailored recommendations drive your organization's SAP BTP maturity through an integrated maturity assessment
  • Strategic decision support helps you make the right decisions at the right time, maximizing value from your SAP BTP investments
  • Comprehensive guidance covers everything from initial planning to advanced enterprise implementations

This framework is particularly valuable for SAP TechEd attendees who want to move beyond tactical implementations to strategic, enterprise-scale SAP BTP adoption.

üîóAccess the BTP Guidance Framework: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/guidance-framework

 

2.  Events: Expanding the SAP Discovery Center Knowledge Universe

The SAP Discovery Center homepage now features a dedicated Events section. This new section serves as a centralized resource for hands-on events designed for both SAP customers and partners, adding another dimension to the Discovery Center's comprehensive learning ecosystem.

Partner and Customer Benefits:

  • Hands-on learning opportunities help customers and partners deepen their knowledge and enhance their technical skills
  • Knowledge transfer that benefits the entire ecosystem by making expertise more accessible to all audiences
  • Networking opportunities connect partners with SAP experts and fellow practitioners
  • Customer value enhancement through access to more knowledgeable, qualified partners
  • Ecosystem strengthening by making partner enablement more visible and accessible
  • Accelerated adoption through joint events that align partner capabilities with customer needs and use cases

üîóDiscover events: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/index.html#

 

3.  Latest Mission Releases: Learning That Drives Results

The SAP Discovery Center continues to expand its use case portfolio with five new missions that address the most pressing enterprise challenges:

üöÄActivate Joule with SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP)
üöÄSetup of Joule in Mobile Start
üöÄAccelerate Smart Supplier Selection with Retrieval-Augmented Generative AI
üöÄMigrate data from SAP Business One to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
üöÄAccelerate your BTP Journey with FRE Acceleration Datasphere Pack

These hands-on experiences provide practical, implementable knowledge that bridges the gap between theoretical understanding and real-world application, ensuring both partners and customers can immediately leverage cutting-edge SAP technologies.

How Missions Guide Your Journey: 

  • Hands-on learning experiences that provide practical skills through guided, interactive tutorials and real-world scenarios
  • Self-paced exploration allows partners and customers to learn at their own speed and revisit content as needed
  • Comprehensive skill development covering beginner to advanced topics across SAP's entire technology portfolio
  • Immediate practical application with step-by-step guidance that can be implemented directly in production environments  
  • Reduced learning curve for new SAP technologies through expert-designed tutorials and best practices

üîó Explore all new missions: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missioncatalog

 

SAP Business Technology Platform ‚Äì Priority Use Cases

Explore the comprehensive range of SAP Business Technology Platform use cases that these missions support here:

üîóhttps://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/use-cases.html?sort=latest_desc

 

Your Next Steps

As you prepare for SAP TechEd 2025, think of these tools as your spacecraft's vital systems: the ROI Calculator as your fuel efficiency monitor, ensuring every investment delivers maximum propulsion; the SAP BTP Guidance Framework as your star maps, guiding you safely through complex architectural decisions; and the Events as your communication array, keeping you connected with the broader SAP ecosystem of knowledge and expertise.

The countdown to SAP TechEd has begun. Your mission parameters are set. These SAP Discovery Center updates aren't just features‚Äîthey're your launch sequence for achieving breakthrough results. Whether you're embarking on your first SAP BTP expedition or you're a seasoned space traveller ready for advanced AI exploration, you now have everything needed for a successful mission.

 

Ready for liftoff to transform your SAP journey?

  • Register now and start building your agenda
  • Connect with us on social media for real-time updates
  • Join the conversation using #SAPTechEd2025

In the next blog, we will discuss our recommended sessions for your SAP TechEd agenda in more detail.

Don't just attend SAP TechEd 2025‚Äîmake it the catalyst for your next breakthrough.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Virtual Business Data Cloud Session Recommendations
entry.content:
Every data team has that moment when the project road map looks clear‚Äîuntil the next critical business need arises. A new AI use case demands sub-second inference. A migration uncovers decades of business warehouse logic you can‚Äôt break. Forecasts need to turn into orders faster than the business can email another spreadsheet. When the stakes are this high, you don‚Äôt need more noise; you need the right signals to move from idea to impact. 

SAP TechEd Virtual is where you compress months of exploration into days of focused learning, with a front‚Äërow seat to how SAP‚Äôs data and AI stack is evolving. Picture your team collaborating: your data engineer lines up an AI‚Äëready backbone, your data scientist charts a governed path from historical data to models, and your business analyst turns insights into coordinated action. To help you build that kind of high-impact agenda, here are a few sessions to look out for by role‚Äîeach chosen to solve real problems you‚Äôre likely tackling or will tackle in the near future. 

For Data Engineers: 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud: Strategy, architecture, and vision (ST107v) 
    The SAP Business Data Cloud solution is a pivotal component of SAP's strategic initiatives. This solution facilitates the development and governance of data products, providing a robust foundation for analytics, artificial intelligence, and intelligent applications. It leverages contextual data and semantics to enhance the capabilities of these technologies. In this session, you will gain a better understanding of the architectural direction and data management priorities, ensuring a comprehensive approach to data management. 
  • SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse (DA203v) 
    Examine best practices for modernizing your SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) application utilizing the SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) solution. Gain insights into minimizing migration risks, preserving existing objects within SAP BW, and delivering these objects as managed data products and intelligent applications while leveraging the most recent data and AI capabilities in SAP BDC. 
  • What‚Äôs next for SAP HANA Cloud: Road map and innovation highlights (DA817v) 
    Gain insights into the future of SAP HANA Cloud in 2025 and beyond. Discover upcoming innovations for AI-driven application development, including the generative AI toolkit, tabular AI functions, and capabilities designed to facilitate data connectivity with AI agents. 
  • Accelerating your AI strategy with SAP HANA Cloud (DA201v) 
    Examine the embedded artificial intelligence capabilities of SAP HANA Cloud, which drive intelligent applications. Gain insights into the functionality of tabular AI, the SAP HANA Cloud vector engine, and the SAP HANA Cloud knowledge graph engine, which collectively support generative AI scenarios. These capabilities enable the development of context-rich, AI-driven applications on SAP Business Technology Platform. 

For Data Scientists: 

  • SAP HANA Cloud: The database for business AI (ST115v) 
    As the database foundation for SAP Business Technology Platform and the SAP Business Data Cloud solution, SAP HANA Cloud is pivotal to SAP's AI vision. Explore how SAP HANA Cloud facilitates advanced analytics, multi-model processing, and intelligent applications, particularly in the realms of machine learning and generative AI. Additionally, delve into the strategic roadmap for its future development. 
  • Build custom AI solutions with the generative AI hub (AI100v) 
    Gain expertise in developing AI applications tailored to your business needs by utilizing the generative AI hub functionality within AI Foundation. Explore the capabilities of crafting prompts and employing grounding, orchestration, and SDKs to create and deploy scalable, fact-based AI applications across various domains, including chat applications and retrieval augmented generation (RAG) systems. 
  • Power up and accelerate your business with SAP‚Äôs AI operating system (ST120v) 
    Prompt engineering has become a relic of the past. Embark on a journey into the future of SAP's AI operating system, your cornerstone for constructing, expanding, and executing AI at an unprecedented scale. Unveil the next frontier in LLM integration, automatic prompt optimization, grounding, and orchestration. Gain insights into how SAP's AI operating system propels secure and transformative AI outcomes. 
  • Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio (AI105v) 
    Discover Joule Studio and the intricacies of extending Joule technology through custom skills and the creation of AI agents. Gain insights into the process of developing, deploying, and managing agents that align seamlessly with your business objectives. Benefit from live demonstrations and a comprehensive walkthrough of pivotal capabilities, catering specifically to developers and IT professionals. 
  • Empower your agents to be responsible (IN200v) 
    Gain an introduction to the evolving standards and protocols governing the interaction of AI agents with the APIs of applications, tools, resources, and large language models. Comprehend the pivotal role of the API Management capability within SAP Integration Suite in facilitating, regulating, and safeguarding these critical agentic integrations. 

For Business Analysts: 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud solution road map (DA806v) 
    Gain insights into the product roadmap for SAP Business Data Cloud and the ongoing development in key areas, such as data center availability, expanded support for data products and intelligent applications, new connectivity options, and other core enhancements. Discover SAP‚Äôs plans to continue delivering innovation to support your data strategy. 
  • Planning and analytics: Innovations powering SAP Business Data Cloud (DA207v) 
    Gain insights into how SAP Business Data Cloud facilitates unified, real-time planning and analytics, empowering businesses to collaborate, adapt, and achieve strategic objectives. Through illustrative examples and live demonstrations, explore how organizations modernize their planning processes, integrate AI insights, and unlock the comprehensive value of enterprise data. 
  • Transforming how people work with Joule technology (ST123v) 
    Gain insights into upcoming innovations, third-party integrations, and customization options from Joule that enable you to interact in innovative ways and access the information you require across your applications. Hear the latest announcements regarding Joule, uncover the driving forces behind its development, and understand how it is propelling the delivery of a groundbreaking user interface for the era of agentic AI.

You won‚Äôt want to miss these impactful sessions that will help you and your business simplify processes, deliver insights in fewer clicks, and create intuitive, human-centered experiences across applications. This virtual conference gives you a front-row view of what‚Äôs ahead in AI-driven application development, from generative tooling and tabular functions to data-to-agent capabilities that connect intelligence directly to your workflows.  

Browse the Virtual TechEd page and sign up today to secure your spot, then build your personalized schedule to lock in the sessions that matter most.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Transitioning from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
SAP TechEd Session: 

  • CS100 - Deep Dive: Transitioning from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM, November 04, 2025, 09:30 AM CET
  • CS160 - Hands-On Workshop: Tools for transitioning from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM, November 04, 2025, 12:30 PM CET

What you will learn about:

In CS100, we‚Äôll explore the strategic and technical journey from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM. You‚Äôll gain insights from a real customer use case and see key tools like SAP Activate, SAP Readiness Check, and selective data transfer in action during a live demo. This session is ideal for those seeking practical guidance and a clear roadmap for transition.

In CS160, you‚Äôll get hands-on experience using SAP-provided tools and environments to explore how to move selected content and understand the transition approach. Whether you're new to SAP Cloud ALM or already planning your migration, this workshop will equip you with the skills and confidence to move forward.

Other related sessions I recommend:

ST106 | Strategy for SAP Cloud ALM with autonomous ALM and Joule

CS805 | Road map for SAP Cloud ALM

Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

Please answer these questions by adding a comment below:

Question:
What‚Äôs your biggest challenge in transitioning from SAP Solution Manager?
A) Understanding the toolset
B) Migrating selected content
C) Aligning teams and processes

Looking forward to seeing you:

Join me in Berlin to explore how SAP Cloud ALM can transform your ALM strategy. Whether you're looking for strategic guidance or hands-on experience, these sessions will provide the tools and insights you need to succeed.
